title: Blended Instructional Design for Understanding Climate Change and Complex Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of science and social studies subjects, and fundamental digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers, conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, emphasizing case-based learning aligned with practitioners' work relevance

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of complex systems (feedback loops, nonlinear interactions, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners acquire model-based problem-solving skills to analyze climate change phenomena from a complex systems perspective.
Learners propose strategies to apply acquired knowledge to real-world cases in the workplace (energy management, sustainability projects, etc.).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
